item.title: Stacey add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Stacey add a quote by Hafiz or Shiraz
item.description: "I wish I could show you when you are lonely and in darkness the astonishing light of your own being." -- Hafiz or Shiraz

item.title: Stacey add a quote by Celine
item.description: "Poverty is a giant, it uses your face like a mop to wipe away the world's garbage." -- Celine

item.title: Stacey add a quote by Courtney Love
item.description: "[Kurt Cobain] had a lot of German in him. Some Irish. But no Jew. I think that if he had had a little Jew he would have [expletive] stuck it out." -- Courtney Love

item.title: Stacey add a quote by Frida Kahlo
item.description: "I drank because I wanted to drown my sorrows. But now the damned things have learned to swim ,and now decency and good behavior weary me." -- Frida Kahlo

item.title: Stacey add a quote by Anonymous
item.description:
"When thou passest through the waters, I will be with thee; and through the rivers, they shall not overflow thee: when thou walkest through the fire, thou shalt not be burned; neither shall the flame kindle upon thee."
[Isaiah 43:2]" -- Anonymous

item.title: Stacey add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "It was not an enemy that reproached me, then I could have borne it. Psalms, 55:12" -- Anonymous

item.title: Stacey add a quote by Jean Paul Sartre
item.description: "Better to die on one's feet than to live on one's knees." -- Jean Paul Sartre

item.title: Stacey add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "LA is the loneliest and most brutal of American cities; NY gets god-awful cold in the winter but there's a feeling of wacky comradeship somewhere in some streets. LA is a jungle." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Stacey add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "Dogmatism is the greatest of mental obstacles to human happiness." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Stacey add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "To be joyous is to be a madman in a world of sad ghosts." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Stacey add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Every spirit builds itself a house; and beyond its house, a world; and beyond its world a heaven. Know then, that the world exists for you: build, therefore, your own world." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Stacey add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "The only way you get Americans to notice anything is to tax them or draft them or kill them." -- John Irving

item.title: Stacey add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "it's not god who's fucked up, it's the screamers who say they believe in him and who claim to pursue their ends in his holy name." -- John Irving

item.title: Stacey add a quote by J. Paul Getty
item.description: "The meek shall inherit the Earth, but not its mineral rights." -- J. Paul Getty

item.title: Stacey add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "If you are going through hell, keep going." -- Winston S. Churchill
